Package com.coasttocoastresearch.apg

Provides classes for the ABNF parser generator, the generated parsers and all necessary supporting classes.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Ast A class representation of the parser-generated Abstract Syntax Tree (AST).
Ast.AstCallback The base class for all AST callback functions.
Generator The Generator class has a static main(0) function which is APG, the ABNF Parser Generator.
GeneratorGrammar This is a sample of the Grammar class generated by APG.
Grammar The Grammar class is the interface between the Parser and the Parser Generator.
Parser Parsers are built by initializing this class with a Generator-generated Grammar and optional user-defined terminals and rule callback functions.
Parser.RuleCallback The base class for all user-defined rule callback functions.
Parser.UdtCallback Base class for all User Defined Terminals (UDT).
Statistics The Statistics class is used to collect and display the statistics on which nodes were visited (hit) by the parser in its journey through the syntax tree and the result of each hit - that is, whether the node matched a phrase of the input string or not.
Trace The Trace class will generate a detailed information record for every operator node the Parser visits during its journey through the syntax tree.
UdtLib  
UdtLib.Alphanum  
UdtLib.Any  
UdtLib.CComment  
UdtLib.Comment  
UdtLib.CppComment  
UdtLib.CRLFLineEnd  
UdtLib.DecNum  
UdtLib.DoubleQuotedString  
UdtLib.ForgivingLineEnd  
UdtLib.HexNum  
UdtLib.LFLineEnd  
UdtLib.LineEnd  
UdtLib.QuotedString  
UdtLib.SemiComment  
UdtLib.SingleQuotedString  
UdtLib.WhiteSpace  
Utilities The Utilities class holds a number of static helper functions.
Utilities.LineCatalog A class for reading a text file and cataloging its text lines.
Utilities.XMLWriter A class for assisting in the writing of XML files.
 

Enum Summary
GeneratorGrammar.RuleNames This enum provides easy to remember enum constants for locating the rule identifiers and names.
GeneratorGrammar.UdtNames This enum provides easy to remember enum constants for locating the rule identifiers and names.
 

Package com.coasttocoastresearch.apg Description

Provides classes for the ABNF parser generator, the generated parsers and all necessary supporting classes.

Java APG, a Java ABNF Parser Generator, is a suite of classes for generating parsers from ABNF grammars and a library of classes to support the parsing of the sentences (input strings) defined by the grammars.

The parser generator is the "main()" function in Generator.java. This function translates an ABNF grammar into a "Grammar" class which contains a complete data representation of the ABNF grammar. This, in turn, is used to build a "Parser" class which will parse the sentences defined by the grammar.

A brief description of the files in the apg package follows:

  • Ast.java: An Ast class can optionally be generated by the Parser, consisting of two records for each node in the AST - one for the downward traversal of the AST and one for upward traversal. Functions are provided for translating and/or displaying (outputing) the AST in native or XML format and for translation of the AST.
  • Generator.java: The main() function in this class is the Parser Generator.
  • GeneratorCommandLine.java: This class handles a number of options that can be used to configure the generator.
  • GeneratorAttributes.java: Classes for computing the grammar's attributes. The attributes detect flaws in the grammars such as left-recursive and cyclic rules as well as several informative attributes such as right- or nested-recursive rules.
  • GeneratorGrammar.java: The generator is itself a parser. It parsers the ABNF for ABNF grammar. This is the Grammar class generated (by a bootstrap generator created with APG Version 6.1) from the ABNF for ABNF grammar.
  • GeneratorSyntax.java: Class that houses the callback functions used to translate the grammar syntax to a Grammar class.
  • Grammar.java: Base class for the Java class representation of an ABNF grammar.
  • Opcodes.java: APG defines operators for each of the ABNF grammar operations, alternation, concatenation, repetition, rules, literal strings, binary strings and ranges (plus a few that are unique to APG.) Opcodes are the data representations of these grammar operations.
  • Parser.java: The Parser class. Creates a parser from the Grammar output of the generator.
  • Statistics.java: The parser may optionally collect statistics, such as the total number of nodes visited in the syntax tree, number of matched nodes, unmatched nodes, etc. The Statisics class generated by the parser has functions for reporting the statistics in varying degrees of detail.
  • Trace.java: When something goes wrong the surest way to track the problem down is to follow the parser through the syntax tree step by step. The optional Trace class will display such a list.
  • UdtLib.java: Java APG introduces the concept of "User Defined Terminals" (UDT). This is a library of UDTs for simple grammars such as alphanum, whitespace, line ends, etc.
  • Utilities.java: A handful of useful utility functions that are used my multiple classes.
